title: Define project scope and requirements
description: Gather and document the project requirements, including features, user stories, technical specifications, and non-functional requirements such as performance, security, scalability, and maintainability. Collaborate with relevant stakeholders (e.g., product owners, subject matter experts, end-users, developers) to capture a comprehensive set of requirements. This process should include creating mockups or wireframes for major features and establishing UI/UX guidelines. Additionally, consider incorporating best practices for code reviews, such as providing clear feedback, ensuring timely response, and promoting constructive discussions.

title: Design system architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components, data flow, and integration points.

title: Design user interface
description: Design the user interface, including wireframes, mockups, and user experience flow.

title: Set up development environment
description: Configure the development environment, including version control, build tools, and deployment pipelines.

title: Implement backend functionality
description: Develop the backend components, including code review simulation logic, data storage, and APIs.

title: Implement frontend functionality
description: Develop the frontend components, including user interface, code editor, and code review visualization.

title: Set up testing framework
description: Establish a testing framework, including unit tests, integration tests, and end-to-end tests.

title: Implement security measures
description: Implement security measures, including authentication, authorization, and data protection.

title: Write documentation
description: Create user guides, developer documentation, and other relevant documentation.

title: Perform code reviews
description: Conduct regular code reviews to ensure code quality, maintainability, and adherence to best practices.
